DataElement.preferredName: Schedule Study Activity Reason Code ISO21090.DSET.CD.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An activity that is anticipated to occur at some time in the future and has been assigned a time or date when that activity is to be performed. EXAMPLE(S): An X-Ray scheduled for February 15 is in state "Scheduled." If John is unable to have the X-Ray on that date, the X-Ray would either be rescheduled (remain in "Scheduled" state, but "date" attribute would change) or moved to state "Canceled." A coded value specifying the motivation, cause, or rationale of an activity. EXAMPLE(S): routine requirement, drug reaction, infectious disease reporting requirement, on patient request

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An ordered list of times at which things are planned to occur.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective; the state of being active._An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.:A system, often of numbered categories, for representation of data.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An ordered list of times at which things are planned to occur.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective; the state of being active.

Concepts.definition: An ordered list of times at which things are planned to occur.
A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.

Property.preferredDefinition: An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.:A system, often of numbered categories, for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader
